items.title: Check system resource usage
items.solution:
Use these commands to check system resources:
- top or htop: View CPU and memory usage
- df -h: Check disk usage
- free -h: View memory usage
- iostat: View IO statistics

items.title: Find large files
items.solution:
Find files larger than 100MB:
find / -type f -size +100M -exec ls -lh {} \; 2>/dev/null

Or use du to check directory sizes:
du -h --max-depth=1 / | sort -hr | head -20

items.title: Restart system services
items.solution:
Restart system services:
- systemctl restart <service>
- service <service> restart

Check service status:
- systemctl status <service>

items.title: View system logs
items.solution:
View logs:
- tail -f /var/log/syslog: Real-time log viewing
- tail -n 100 <file>: View last 100 lines
- journalctl -u <service>: View systemd service logs
- grep 'error' <file>: Search for errors
